Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class IncomingListener.Please

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.IncomingListener.Please
  • Enclosing interface:
    IncomingListener
    public static class IncomingListener.Please
extends java.lang.Object
    Struct returned from IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent). Use the static constructor methods to create instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond()
      Use this as the return value of IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true.
      static IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond​(OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as doNotRespond() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this (non-)response.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithError​(int gattStatus)
      Send an error/status code back to the client.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithError​(int gattStatus, OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as respondWithError(int) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess()
      Use this as the return value of IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true and ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() ExchangeListener.Type.isWrite() is true and you consider the write successful.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(byte[] data)
      Use this as the return value of IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() ExchangeListener.Type.isRead() is true and you can respect the read request and respond with data.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(byte[] data, OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as respondWithSuccess(byte[]) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as respondWithSuccess() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(FutureData futureData)
      Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[]) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.
      static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(FutureData futureData, OutgoingListener listener)
      Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[], OutgoingListener) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • doNotRespond

        public static IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond()
        Use this as the return value of IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true.

      • doNotRespond

        public static IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond​(OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as doNotRespond() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this (non-)response. Your OutgoingListener.onEvent(OutgoingListener.OutgoingEvent) will simply be called with OutgoingListener.Status.NO_RESPONSE_ATTEMPTED.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(FutureData futureData)
        Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[]) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(FutureData futureData,
                                                         OutgoingListener listener)
        Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[], OutgoingListener) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(byte[] data)
        Use this as the return value of IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() ExchangeListener.Type.isRead() is true and you can respect the read request and respond with data.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(byte[] data,
                                                         OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as respondWithSuccess(byte[]) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess()
        Use this as the return value of IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true and ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() ExchangeListener.Type.isWrite() is true and you consider the write successful.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess​(OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as respondWithSuccess() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)

      • respondWithError

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithError​(int gattStatus)
        Send an error/status code back to the client. See static final int members of BleStatuses starting with GATT_ for possible values.

      • respondWithError

        public static IncomingListener.Please respondWithError​(int gattStatus,
                                                       OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as respondWithError(int) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)
